segments.text: I watch the woman, so absorbed in her task, blissfully ignorant of the water pooling around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a kind of peace in her routine, but it’s fragile, teetering on the edge of chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, however, are the embodiment of youthful exuberance; it’s infectious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself rooting for them, wishing they could just snatch a cookie without a hitch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I feel this simmering anger because they’re breaking the rules right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I glance at the water, dripping and pooling, and I wonder how much longer it will be ignored.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: For every joyful moment, there’s a risk of a slip or a crash waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
